      • buildScreenshotItem

        public static void buildScreenshotItem(java.io.File screenShotFile,
                       com.jme3.math.Vector2f loc,
                       IStage stage,
                       float rot)
        Creates a screenshot item from an image file.
        Parameters:
        screenShotFile - The image file the item is to display.
        loc - The location of the item on screen. ~ @param stage Environment's stage.
        rot - Rotation of the item on screen.
        displayWidth - Width of the environment.
        displayWidth - Height of the environment.

      • generateItemFromFile

        public static IItem generateItemFromFile(java.io.File file,
                         IStage stage,
                         float deceleration,
                         float importImageSizeLimit,
                         com.jme3.math.ColorRGBA borderColour)
        Creates item for a file. If the file has a wav or mp3 extension an audio playing item is created. If the file has a jpg or png extension then an image item is created. Otherwise no item is created. Any items created are made legible for feedback and network flick capable.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to potentially create an item from.
        stage - Environment stage node
        deceleration - The rate of the deceleration when flicked. A value of -1 will make the item unflickable.
        importImageSizeLimit - The max width or height of an item.
        borderColour - The colour of the border around the item. Can be invisible.
        Returns:
        The Item generated for the given file, or null if the file is not valid.

      • generateItemFromFile

        public static IItem generateItemFromFile(java.io.File file,
                         IStage stage,
                         float deceleration,
                         float importImageSizeLimit,
                         com.jme3.math.ColorRGBA borderColour,
                         float minScale,
                         float maxScale)
        Creates item for a file. If the file has a wav or mp3 extension an audio playing item is created. If the file has a jpg or png extension then an image item is created. Otherwise no item is created. Any items created are made legible for feedback and network flick capable.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to potentially create an item from.
        stage - Environment stage node
        deceleration - The rate of the deceleration when flicked. A value of -1 will make the item unflickable.
        importImageSizeLimit - The max width or height of an item.
        borderColour - The colour of the border around the item. Can be invisible.
        minScale - The minimum scale the item can be scaled it.
        maxScale - The maximum scale the item can be scaled it.
        Returns:
        The Item generated for the given file, or null if the file is not valid.

      • inBox

        public static boolean inBox(com.jme3.math.Vector2f loc,
            com.jme3.math.Vector2f boxLoc,
            com.jme3.math.Vector2f dim)
        Checks if a location is within a box.
        Parameters:
        loc - The location to check is inside the box.
        boxLoc - The location of the box.
        dim - Dimensions of the box.
        Returns:
        Boolean representing whether the location given is in the box.

               float radius)
        Checks if a location is within a circle.
        Parameters:
        loc - The location to check is inside the circle.
        circleLoc - The location of the circle.
        radius - Radius of the circle.
        Returns:
        Boolean representing whether the location given is in the box.

      • pile

        public static void pile(IItem[] items,
        float x,
        float y,
        float angleOffSet,
        float positionOffset)
        Takes an array of items and stacks them in a pile at various rotations.
        Parameters:
        items - The items to be stacked.
        x - X location at which the pile of items should appear.
        y - Y location at which the pile of items should appear.
        angleOffSet - The degree to which items in the pile may be rotated.
        positionOffset - How far along an axis from the centre of the pile an item may be positioned.
